title: CAA will be notified before Lok Sabha elections: Shah
description: Home Minister Amit Shah accuses Rahul Gandhi of concocting a conspiracy theory around caste census and asserts that the Citizenship Amendment Act will be notified before the Lok Sabha elections. Read more.

title: 'He's In A Tough Position': Mitch McConnell's Influence Wanes In Trump's GOP
description: A growing number of conservative senators are in open rebellion with his tactics, heeding instead the words of former President Donald Trump.

title: Tory by-election candidate says he will only do the job for a year
description: Sam Bromiley is running to replace Tory MP Chris Skidmore, who quit over a bill to guarantee annual oil and gas licensing rounds

title: Haley hopes to boost election bid with attacks on Trump’s and Biden’s ages
description: Candidate’s ailing campaign will use mobile billboard in her home state to highlight her opponents’ many verbal gaffes

title: Are the Politics of Climate Change Going Out of Fashion?
description: Today we look at why Labour has U-turned on £28 billion of green spending ahead of the next general election and how attitudes towards climate policies have shifted in recent years. Paddy and Laura also discuss the upcoming by-elections in Kingswood and Wellingborough and what voters in both constituencies are most concerned about.

title: Trump says he wishes general election would be held next Tuesday
description: Former President Donald Trump says he wants the general election to be held on Tuesday after his win in Nevada. Mr Trump made his remarks at the Treasure Island Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas on Thursday evening.

title: Former GOP candidate Vivek Ramaswamy claims Democrats could replace Biden with Michelle Obama as Las Vegas odds already have her as THIRD most likely to win the presidency ...
description: Former GOP candidate Vivek Ramaswamy claimed Democrats could replace Biden with Michelle Obama as Las Vegas odds already have her as the third most likely to win the presidency.

title: Trump attacks Haley for absence of her husband, who is deployed
description: Former President Donald Trump, riding high after one of the best days of his campaign, used a rally in South Carolina on Saturday to attack rival Nikki Haley in her home state — and to mock the absence of her husband,

title: Labour considers banning sale of energy drinks to children
description: Ban has been proposed for inclusion in election manifesto amid rising health concerns for young people

title: Pakistan army urges unity as ex-PMs both declare election win
description: Pakistan's powerful army chief has urged the country to leave "anarchy and polarisation" behind as two ex-prime ministers declared victory in an election that has defied expectations. With most results in, independent candidates linked to jailed former PM Imran Khan have won most seats.

title: Why the race for the House is the one to watch in 2024
description: It won’t suck up anywhere near the oxygen of the presidential election, but the race for the US House of Representatives may be the most exciting campaign to watch in 2024.

title: Pakistan election – live: Imran Khan’s PTI calls for protest amid concerns of fraud in inconclusive polls
description: The US and the UK expressed serious concerns about the fairness of the Pakistan parliamentary elections as former prime ministers Nawaz Sharif and Imran Khan both claimed victory with no clear results in sight.

title: General election poll tracker
description: The Telegraph’s poll tracker shows that Labour continues to have a dominating lead over the Tories, who were last ahead in late 2021. On Thursday, the Conservative Party will face by-elections in both Kingswood and Wellingborough, which had both been Tory seats.

title: Done Deal: Despite Labour's Latest U-Turn, Is The Election Result Already Decided?
description: Rishi Sunak and Keir Starmer have both had a week to forget, but voters seem to have already made up their minds.

title: Pakistan election: Imran Khan and Nawaz Sharif each claim advantage
description: The jailed former Pakistani Prime Minister Imran Khan has claimed victory in Thursday's general election and called on his supporters to celebrate. Independent candidates linked to him have won most seats so far, with the majority of seats declared.

title: Piers Morgan’s change of programme hits Rupert Murdoch’s TV dream
description: Piers Morgan, the outspoken presenter, delivered a blow to Rupert Murdoch’s British TV news channel with the damning assessment this week that his daily show had become an “unnecessary straitjacket”.

title: Prosecutor faces political glare after Biden report
description: Special Counsel Robert Hur placed a spotlight on US President Joe Biden's biggest political weakness - his age - by describing him as "an elderly man with a poor memory" who had difficulty recalling of key milestones in his own life.

title: Imran Khan posts AI video declaring victory in Pakistani election as candidates backed by his party win most seats despite him being behind bars and communications blackout
description: In the message, which is usually delivered by word through his lawyers, the AI version of Imran Khan rejected rival Nawaz Sharif's earlier claim to victory

title: How political deepfakes could decide who wins the general election
description: More people are voting in national elections across the planet this year — some two billion-plus — than at any time in history. So how worried should we be about AI’s ability to sway voters?

title: Republican Larry Hogan Is Running For Senate In Maryland
description: Former Maryland Gov. Larry Hogan (R) is running for Maryland’s open U.S. Senate seat, shaking up what was expected to be a breezy general-election contest for Democrats in a deep blue state. The two-term governor opted to join the fray on Friday, the deadline to file paperwork to replace retiring Democrat Ben Cardin.

title: Kemp: Presidential election should not be a ‘race to the bottom’
description: This election should be about results, not personalities. It should be about the future of our country, not a race to the bottom," the Georgia governor told students at Washington and Lee University.

title: Hard-right lawmaker could disrupt GOP plans to take Senate
description: Montana Republicans gathered in a hotel ballroom this weekend aiming to unite ahead of the 2024 election and defeat three-term incumbent Democrat U.S. Sen. Jon Tester

title: Prabowo Subianto's third race for Indonesian presidency may seal the deal
description: After vying for Indonesia's top office for more than a decade, Prabowo Subianto is finally eyeing victory at this week's presidential election.

title: Imran Khan claims victory in Pakistan poll but military might have final say
description: Jailed leader says he has support to form next government but analysts say results only suit the army

title: Imran Khan's party defied the odds in Pakistan election with strong showing
description: With no clear winner and both Imran Khan and Nawaz Sharif claiming victory, it’s unclear who will form Pakistan's next government following an election that many claimed was marred by meddling from the country’s powerful military.

title: Russia's presidential election will affect war in Ukraine – Estonian General Staff
description: The presidential elections in Russia scheduled for March will have an impact on the situation on the battlefield in Ukraine, the Estonian General Staff has suggested. Source: Estonian public broadcaster ERR,

title: Trump, who has skirted attacks on Biden’s age, leans in as controversy swirls
description: Trump has generally avoided directly addressing the age question, even claiming Biden’s mental unfitness stems from factors other than his age.

title: Can Biden emerge from his ‘cocoon’?
description: DEMS TO BIDEN: LEAVE THE BASEMENT — The fallout continues this morning from special counsel ROBERT HUR’s damning report depicting President JOE BIDEN as a doddering old man. To start with, Democratic officials are pushing for a series of tactical changes at the White House. They want Biden to go on offense.

title: Pakistan election: Imran Khan's party wants to form government, threatens protests
description: Pakistan's army chief congratulated the country on Saturday for the "successful conduct" of its national elections, saying the nation needed "stable hands" to move on from the politics of "anarchy and polarisation".

title: N.S. Liberals promise to cut HST in bid to rebuild support
description: Still stinging from the 2021 election loss to the PCs, Nova Scotia Liberals are promising taxpayers a two-point cut to the HST if they are returned to power in the next election.

title: Not sure who to vote for in Tempe? Candidates' answers to our 10 questions may help
description: Only three of the five candidates can win in March. Here's where they stand on everything from homelessness to election integrity.

title: Pakistan election: Aide of Imran Khan says party aims to form government, wants results released
description: Candidates backed by the party of jailed Pakistani opposition leader Imran Khan plan to form a government, a senior aide to the former prime minister said on Saturday, urging supporters to peacefully protest if final election results are not released.

title: The race for George Santos’ congressional seat could offer clues to how suburbs will vote this year
description: The Tuesday contest for the House seat held by Santos until his recent expulsion is shaping up to be a bellwether in the fight for control of Congress.

title: Indonesians join the final campaign events before the presidential election
description: The three candidates in Indonesia’s presidential election have held their final campaign events in front of tens of thousands of people, four days before citizens cast their votes in the world’s third

title: The Race to Replace George Santos Is Going to Be a Close One
description: New York’s 3 rd Congressional District is gearing up for a very special election on Tuesday to replace disgraced Republican George Santos. And the race between establishment Democrat Tom Suozzi and Republican newcomer Mazi Pilip is expected to be a nail-biter.

title: Pakistan hits back at criticism of election as both Imran Khan and Nawaz Sharif claim victory
description: Pakistan has hit back at concerns expressed by the US, UK, and EU, calling for an investigation into the country’s electoral process, as both former prime minister Nawaz Sharif and jailed ex-prime minister Imran Khan claimed victory in the general elections.

title: Pakistan Ex-PM Imran Khan Aide Says Party Aims to Form Government
description: Volunteers for former Prime Minister Imran Khan's party Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) look on as they watch results on TV screens after the end of the polling during a general election at the party's main office in Islamabad, Pakistan, February 8, 2024. REUTERS/Charlotte Greenfield/File Photo

title: Pakistan Election 2024: US, UK, and EU urge investigation into Pak general elections
description: The United States, Britain, and the European Union have expressed concerns regarding Pakistan's electoral integrity, calling for an investigation into alleged irregularities, interference, and fraud.

title: How Old Is Too Old to Be President? An Uncomfortable Question Arises Again.
description: Either of the leading 2024 candidates would be the oldest occupant of the Oval Office ever by the end of his term, and neither seems eager to discuss the ramifications.

title: Pakistan defends election conduct amid criticism, asserts curbs vital
description: A clash in North Waziristan resulted in the leader of a political party being wounded and two police officers losing their lives. The violence erupted

title: How Donald Trump’s shadow could eclipse Nikki Haley’s Super Tuesday efforts
description: Even voters who support Nikki Haley don't see a path to victory for the former South Carolina governor. Could their apathy about her chances of success be a self-fulfilling prophecy?

title: What is ranked choice voting, the contentious election method expanding across the nation?
description: Ranked choice voting has been popularized in the U.S. and continues to face backlash from some critics over its effectiveness and fairness. But what is it exactly?

title: Indonesia Polls Favor Ex-General Seen Bolstering Ties With China
description: Days before Indonesians vote for their first new president in a decade, opinion polls favor an ex-general bent on continuing an economic strategy anchored on business ties to China while vowing to sustain a more neutral foreign policy stance between Washington and Beijing.

title: Local legislator called out for lagging campaign reports
description: Guilford, said that he's working with state election officials to resolve campaign finance reports that were cited this week by a longtime political researcher as having chronic shortcomings. Bob Hall,

title: As Indonesia Goes to the Polls, Women and Minority Candidates Face Challenges
description: As the world's third-largest democracy prepares for national elections on Wednesday, women and minority candidates face questions about whether voters will accept them

title: Wealthy Indonesians Set to Win No Matter Who Becomes President
description: A group of powerful Indonesian oligarchs gathered at a cafe in Jakarta last month in a show of support for Prabowo Subianto, underlining why the ex-general may be third time lucky in the upcoming presidential election.
